methods.name: Interviews

budget.extra_information: Cost dependent on the project area, number of participants, enumerators needed, etc.

resource_intensive.extra_information: Usually enumerators' salary is not very high

costs.extra_information: Transportation, data entry tools (tablets, notebooks), personnel for interviews

methods.description: Interviews involve direct, structured, semi-structured, or unstructured conversations with participants to gather qualitative and/or quantitative data. They provide insights into personal experiences, perceptions, and context-specific information.
pros: Allows flexibility to explore unexpected topics that arise during discussions.
Provides human context and nuanced understanding.
cons: Time-intensive, especially for data collection and analysis.
Risk of bias introduced by interviewer or respondent.
Limited scalability, particularly for large populations.
Relies heavily on the skill and training of the interviewer.
Potential for higher costs if conducted over remote or challenging geographic areas.

methods.name: Questionnaires

budget.extra_information: Dependent on project area, sample size, and need to purchase electronic support materials (e.g., tablets)

resource_intensive.extra_information: Requires staff for data collection and processing

costs.extra_information: Printing or digital survey tools, training of enumerators, transportation for data collection

methods.description: Questionnaires are structured tools for collecting standardized information from a large sample. They can be self-administered or conducted by enumerators and are ideal for gathering quantitative data and some qualitative insights.
pros: Scalable and efficient for large populations.
Can be self-administered, reducing labor costs.
Easy to automate and analyze using digital tools.
cons: Potential for low response rates in self-administered formats.
Requires careful design to avoid ambiguity or bias.
Relies on respondent literacy and understanding.

methods.name: Focus Group Discussions

budget.extra_information: Dependent on facilitator costs, participant incentives, etc.

skills_required.extra_information: Facilitation, Group dynamics management and Qualitative analysis

resource_intensive.extra_information: Requires skilled facilitators and detailed transcription/analysis

costs.extra_information: Facilitator, refreshments, participant compensation if applicable

methods.description: Focus Group Discussions involve guided conversations with a small group of participants to explore perceptions, opinions, and experiences on a specific topic. They allow for dynamic interaction and deeper insights.
pros: Encourages diverse viewpoints and group interaction.
Adaptable to various topics and project phases.
Can uncover unanticipated issues or ideas.
cons: Requires skilled facilitators for effective sessions.
Risk of dominant voices overshadowing others (cultural, religious, and gender dynamics at play).
Less suitable for sensitive or individual-focused topics.
